query:
I need you to fetch and read the full content of these two articles:
1. https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview
2. https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview

For each article, give me:
- All specific interview questions listed
- Whether it describes first-person experience or is a prep guide
- Any details about the interview process (rounds, format)
- Key topics covered

content.text:
### Article 1: OpenAI AI Engineer Interview (https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview)[[1]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview)

- **All specific interview questions listed**: None listed verbatim. The article describes expected topics and provides sample answers but no exact questions from interviews.[[1]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview)

- **First-person experience or prep guide?**: Primarily a preparation guide with advice, tips, common pitfalls, and sample responses. No first-person personal interview experience described.[[1]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview)

- **Details about the interview process**: 9 rounds total over ~10 weeks. Initial screen (2 rounds: narrative/project discussion, likely virtual). Technical assessment (3 rounds: coding, system design, ML/LLM concepts). Onsite (4 rounds: presentation, coding, system design, behavioral). Interviewers are engineers who ship features like ChatGPT/Codex.[[1]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview)

- **Key topics covered**: LLMs/RAG/AI Agents; ML System Design & MLOps; Coding & Algorithms (Python); ML/Deep Learning/Statistics; Cloud Infrastructure & Serving; SQL/Data Retrieval; Behavioral/Forward-Deployed Execution.[[1]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/openai-ai-engineer-interview)

### Article 2: Mistral Machine Learning Engineer Interview (https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview)[[2]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview)

- **All specific interview questions listed** (presented as practice samples, not verbatim candidate experiences):
  - Machine Learning Fundamentals: "Why might accuracy increase while log loss stalls?"; "Explain the gradient of logistic regression with L2 regularization."; (Implied) "Why use log loss vs. PR AUC under class imbalance?"
  - Deep Learning: "How to debug a deep learning training run that isn't converging?"; "What is RMSNorm and how does it differ from LayerNorm? What bugs can occur?"; (Implied) "Explain RoPE and common bugs in implementation."
  - LLMs & AI Agents: "How to debug a RAG chatbot that gives confident but wrong answers?"; "How to secure an AI agent system handling tools and secrets?"
  - ML Coding: Implement stratified K-fold splitting; Implement logistic regression with SGD/L2/early stopping in NumPy; Implement top-p (nucleus) sampling; Implement autoregressive generation with top-p; Specific prompt: "Implement a function that samples one token id from a 1D array of logits using temperature scaling, optional top_k filtering, and optional top_p (nucleus) filtering..."
  - ML System Design: Design RAG system; Design cost/safety-aware AI agent framework.
  - MLOps/Cloud: "How to scale LLM inference service under high concurrency?"; "How to debug a sudden spike in latency or errors post-deployment?"
  - Behavioral: "Tell me about a time you debugged a production ML issue."; "Describe a situation where you had competing priorities—how did you decide?"; "Tell me about a time you identified a major risk in an AI system—what did you do?"[[2]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview)

- **First-person experience or prep guide?**: Primarily a preparation guide based on candidate reports and insights, with structured advice, samples, and tips. No first-person personal experience.[[2]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview)

- **Details about the interview process**: 6 rounds total over ~6 weeks (faster possible). Initial screen (2 virtual/phone rounds). Take-home (1 coding assignment). Onsite (3 technical deep dives: modeling/coding, design, behavioral; primarily in-person at Paris office, some virtual). Interviewers: ML engineers, modeling experts, possibly research/product.[[2]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview)

- **Key topics covered**: ML Fundamentals; Deep Learning; LLMs/AI Agents (incl. MoE, attention); ML Coding (NumPy/Python); ML System Design; MLOps/Cloud Infrastructure; Behavioral (ambiguity, ownership).[[2]](https://www.datainterview.com/blog/mistral-machine-learning-engineer-interview)
